qas.question: What was the title of Molotov’s report called?

answers.text: On the Foreign Policy of the Soviet Union

qas.question: According to Molotov, what was the goal of the west?
Under what guise does the west perform their international policing?

plausible_answers.text: On the Foreign Policy of the Soviet Union

qas.question: What wasn't the title of Molotov’s report called?

plausible_answers.text: On the Foreign Policy of the Soviet Union

qas.question: What was the title of Stalin’s report called?
According to Molotov, what wasn't the goal of the west?
According to Molotov, what was the goal of the east?
Under what guise does the east perform their international policing?

context: Molotov declared in his report entitled "<a0_0><b3_0><b4_0>On the Foreign Policy of the Soviet Union<b4_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/>" (31 October 1939) held on the fifth (extraordinary) session of the Supreme Soviet, that the Western "ruling circles" disguise their intentions with the pretext of <a2_0><b7_0>defending democracy<b7_0/><a2_0/> against Hitlerism, declaring "their aim in war with Germany is nothing more, nothing less than <a1_0><b5_0><b6_0>extermination of Hitlerism<b6_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/>. [...] There is absolutely no justification for this kind of war. The ideology of Hitlerism, just like any other ideological system, can be accepted or rejected, this is a matter of political views. But everyone grasps, that an ideology can not be exterminated by force, must not be finished off with a war."
